brief_summary.textblock:
Design: Observational - Cross study with followed up for 30 days. The Primary Objective is
      to realize a record that reflects a national overview of the role of cardiac catheterization
      in patients with congenital heart disease in hospitals distributed by geographic density of
      each region of Brazil.

clinical_study.brief_title: CHAIN_brazilian Registry of Congenital HeArt Disease INtervention and Angiography

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients admitted in the hemodynamic sector with diagnosed or suspected congenital
      cardiopathy and undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic cardiac catheterization. Participants
      release the data in (e-CRF) electronics system. Sample: 2000 records.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients admitted to the hemodynamic sector with diagnosed or suspected congenital
             cardiopathy and undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic cardiac catheterization.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing hybrid approach to intervention, with the aid of cardiac surgery
             to realization of cardiac catheterization.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients admitted to the hemodynamic sector with diagnosed or suspected congenital
        cardiopathy and undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic cardiac catheterization.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 0 _ Brazilian Registry of Congenital HeArt Disease INtervention and Angiography

oversight_info.authority: Brazil:  HCor's IRB  (the study is a registry, there is no Drugs and Medicinal Devices)

primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of serious complications of cardiac catheterization in congenital heart procedure-related (occurring within 7 days after the procedure or until hospital discharge, whichever occurs first, and following 30 days), such as embolization of the prosthesis, cardiac arrhythmias, trauma vascular intracardiac injury, death, etc
primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of serious complications of cardiac catheterization in congenital heart

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: Netherlands: Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports
